skill.name: software-architecture
skill.description: Document software architecture using ARCHITECTURE.md and docs/*.md files with Mermaid diagrams. Use proactively when ARCHITECTURE.md exists in project root, or invoke to create initial architecture documentation. Covers system design, data flows, component relationships, and code organization with references to key entry points and abstractions.
skill.summary: Document software architecture using ARCHITECTURE.md and docs/*.md files with Mermaid diagrams. Use ...
skill.author: Chemiseblanc

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill containing no executable code, no network calls, no filesystem access beyond standard documentation reading, and no external command execution. All content consists of markdown templates and guidance for software architecture documentation.

content.value_statement: Software projects often lack clear architecture documentation. This skill provides templates and patterns for documenting system design, component relationships, and data flows using Mermaid diagrams.
actual_capabilities: Create ARCHITECTURE.md with system overview and C4 diagrams
Generate component detail documents in docs/*.md
Document entry points and key abstractions with file references
Build Mermaid diagrams for system context, containers, and components
Map data flows and code organization patterns
Maintain architecture docs during refactoring and updates
limitations: Does not auto-generate diagrams from code analysis
Does not validate existing architecture against code structure
Does not integrate with diagram rendering tools
Requires manual creation of documentation files

use_cases.title: Document legacy system architecture
use_cases.description: Map existing codebases to clear architecture documentation for onboarding and knowledge transfer

use_cases.title: Establish architecture documentation standards
use_cases.description: Create templates and patterns for team-wide architecture documentation consistency

use_cases.title: Maintain living documentation
use_cases.description: Update architecture docs during refactoring and structural changes

prompt_templates.title: Analyze codebase
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this codebase structure. Identify entry points, major components, and key abstractions. Create ARCHITECTURE.md with C4 Context diagram, entry points table, and links to component detail docs.

prompt_templates.title: Add component doc
prompt_templates.prompt: Create docs/new-component.md for the new service. Include C4 Component diagram, key files table, and data flow sequence diagram showing how it interacts with other components.

prompt_templates.title: Update architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the changes in this PR. Update ARCHITECTURE.md to reflect new component relationships, update any affected diagrams, and verify file references in entry points table are accurate.

prompt_templates.title: Create data flow
prompt_templates.prompt: Document the data flow for the processing pipeline. Use a Mermaid flowchart showing stages, transformations, and error handling paths. Include sequence diagram for key interactions.

output_examples.input: Analyze this REST API project and create architecture documentation
output: C4 Context diagram showing users, API, database, and external services
Entry points table documenting main.py, api/routes/, and core/
Key abstractions table with Handler, Service, Repository classes
docs/ folder structure with component detail docs templates

best_practices: Keep diagrams simple with 3-5 nodes initially, add detail only when it improves clarity
Use consistent file paths and naming conventions across all documentation
Update architecture docs immediately after structural changes or refactoring
anti_patterns: Creating overly complex diagrams with too many nodes and relationships
Including implementation details in high-level C4 Context diagrams
Failing to link component detail docs from main ARCHITECTORY.md

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. All tools can read and write markdown files with Mermaid diagrams.

faq.question: What diagram types does this skill support?
faq.answer: C4 Context, C4 Container, C4 Component, Flowchart, Sequence, ER Diagram, and Class Diagram patterns.

faq.question: Does this skill generate diagrams from code?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides templates and patterns. Users must create diagrams based on their understanding of the codebase.

faq.question: Is my code data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads files you specify and writes documentation files. No data is sent externally.

faq.question: How does this skill integrate with existing docs?
faq.answer: The skill creates ARCHITECTURE.md in project root and optional docs/*.md files. Both are standard markdown format.

faq.question: How is this different from code analysis tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides documentation templates and guidance. It does not parse code structure or auto-generate diagrams from analysis.
